location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘FRONTIER OF TURKEY IN EUROPE; DEMILITARIZED ZONES OF THE STRAITS AND IN THRACE; THE ISLANDS (DODEKANESIA); GALLIPOLI PENINSULA’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:580 x 430 mm, on sheet 660 x 560 mm.Materials:coloured ink on paper.

mods.abstract: Map of south-eastern Europe (Turkey, Greece, Bulgaria) affected by the Treaty of Lausanne. The map indicates coastline, hydrology, and human settlements. Also marked on the map are: the Turkish frontier (solid red line); the demilitarised zone in Thrace (blue crosshatch); the demilitarised zones and islands as defined by article 4 of the Convention of the Straits (red crosshatch); the southern frontier of Bulgaria, as established by the Treaty of Neuilly (solid purple line). The Gallipoli peninsula is shown in an inset in the top right corner of the main map.The map was prepared by the War Office in February 1923.
